text:
so I tested to update a theme from a portal client and it wen pretty bad...
It basically duplicated each file/template even if most of them didn't changed and were using the "original" version of the marketplace...

Is it the expected behaviour?
Because I don't think is the way to go :anguished:
I’ve heard that it just pulls a new set of the files into the portal and you have to manually swap pages to use the templates

yeah, thats pretty much is... while I can understand why. I think HS could replace the original one if those weren't modify. And keep the module IDs, check for flex cols and so on.
Because this is crazy when you have several templates, CMs and files...

agreed. From what I’ve heard in the past, the Marketplace set up as it is, is basically the MVP for the marketplace, and they have plans to really improve that process as well as the approval process.
^ <@U22PNRAJD> some good feedback for our marketplace

Primary concerns for the way the marketplace works.

updating templates for the users requires manual effort. (swapping templates) (there’s no method for a marketplace provider to push bug fixes.)

There’s currently no concept of child-theming, so if developers make customizations they need to re-implement every time they update.
I have done something to solve it :slightly_smiling_face:
Although, it need to be in variables, I am not talking about changes in the template level for example
But as far as I know they are working in a *theme* thing that will give us enough power for that child-theming

so for the child thing, I have a setup file that I load everywhere and handle all the things that need to be loaded across templates etc.
In this file you can call your file with all the config variables related.
Then another import to a non existing file where the portal/project/dev related can load its own vars + overwrite the default values.
On this way you can keep your child working as a charm!
or thats what I though, until today when I published an update and realised that all the files, CMs and templates where duplicated :face_with_rolling_eyes:
*spam alert* this and most of our secrets,hacks and/or snippets are available for you in the marketplace through our *{{modular}}* theme

<@U7ADCU3BM> sneaky way to get us to buy your theme lol

“we have secrets in our marketplace items.”

Are there any Legal modules/templates that help Legal departments upload documents as Word docs converting them to a Webpage and then keep versioning of the Word docs being upload, so for Webpage versioning Legal can look back at what Word legal doc was pertaining to the content at that specific time?
not as far as I’m aware. HubSpot does keep revision history of page edits which lawyers would have to deem if that was sufficient for their needs.

Word docs to actual html - you might be able to make a custom module that uses JS to do that but honestly it’s probably easier to just build the page and have someone maintain the text in the page or just allow someone to download the word docs.
